org.pircbotx
Class MultiBotManager

java.lang.Object
  org.pircbotx.MultiBotManager

public class MultiBotManager
extends Object

Manager that provides an easy way to create bots on many different servers with the same or close to the same information. All important setup methods have been mirrored here. For documentation, see their equivalent PircBotX methods.

Author:
Leon Blakey

Method Detail

createBot

public void createBot(String hostname)
Create a bot using the specified hostname, 6667 for port, and no password or socketfactory

Parameters:
hostname - The hostname of the server to connect to.

createBot

public void createBot(String hostname,
                      int port,
                      SocketFactory socketFactory)
Create a bot using the specified hostname, port and socketfactory with no password

Parameters:
hostname - The hostname of the server to connect to.
port - The port number to connect to on the server.
socketFactory - The factory to use for creating sockets, including secure sockets

createBot

public void createBot(String hostname,
                      int port,
                      String password,
                      SocketFactory socketFactory)
Create a bot using the specified hostname, port, password, and socketfactory

Parameters:
hostname - The hostname of the server to connect to.
port - The port number to connect to on the server.
password - The password to use to join the server.
socketFactory - The factory to use for creating sockets, including secure sockets

connectAll

public void connectAll()
                throws IOException,
                       IrcException,
                       NickAlreadyInUseException
Connect all bots to their respective hosts and channels

Throws:
IOException - if it was not possible to connect to the server.
IrcException - if the server would not let us join it.
NickAlreadyInUseException - if our nick is already in use on the server.

setEncoding

public void setEncoding(String encoding)
                 throws UnsupportedEncodingException
Throws:
UnsupportedEncodingException
